intro: Gardenia fragrans, commonly known as the gardenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces fragrant, white or yellowish flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is prized for its ornamental value and strong, sweet scent. Gardenia fragrans thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil and partial shade. Its flowers are often used in floral arrangements and are also cultivated for their medicinal properties.
